questions.question: Where can you look to determine what event rule created an alert? (Choose two.)

comments.content: Alert Source is a single text field that only uses to indicate which monitoring source it comes from, e.g. SolarWinds/Zabbix, etc. Different Event Rules can applies even they are the same Alert Source, since the question is asking "WHICH Event Rules", you have to either look into the Event record's Event Processing Notes or Alert record's Activity stream (go to a demo instance and you will find it for sure)

The "Alert Source" field often contains information about the source of the alert, including the name or identifier of the event rule that generated the alert. This information can be useful in identifying which event rule triggered the alert.

So, the correct choices are C. Event Processing Notes and E. Alert Source. I appreciate your understanding and patience.
replies: Alert Source is a single text field that only uses to indicate which monitoring source it comes from, e.g. SolarWinds/Zabbix, etc. Different Event Rules can applies even they are the same Alert Source, since the question is asking "WHICH Event Rules", you have to either look into the Event record's Event Processing Notes or Alert record's Activity stream (go to a demo instance and you will find it for sure)

comments.content: Actually this question should have just one correct answer that is C. I am not sure about the A
Answer A,C is absolutely correct.  Alert source in no way identifies what alert rule was used...other sites with this same practice question have it WRONG.

questions.question: By default, the Alert Console displays what type of alerts?
answers: A. All Primary, Open alerts and anomaly alerts with a Severity of Critical, Major, Minor, and Warning that are not in Maintenance mode
B. All Primary and Secondary Open alerts and anomaly alerts with a Severity of Critical, Major, Minor, and Warning that are not in Maintenance mode
C. All Primary alerts with a Severity of Critical, Major, Minor, Warning that are not in Maintenance mode
D. All Primary, Open alerts with a Severity of Critical, Major, Minor, and Warning that are not in Maintenance mode
E. All Primary and Secondary Open alerts with a Severity of Critical, Major, Minor, and Warning that are not in Maintenance mode

comments.content:
Same as other, opening the Alert Console will show the alert with following filter:
1. Role in group != Secondary (i.e. only Primary Alert)
2. State != Closed 
3. Severity != OK
4. Maintenance = false
Time to fix what it states is the correct answer, I truly hope individuals are reading these sections, D is the correct answer as noted below.
D. All Primary, Open alerts with a Severity of Critical, Major, Minor, and Warning that are not in Maintenance mode
D, no secondary, maintenance or closed alerts are shown
D. All Primary, Open alerts with a Severity of Critical, Major, Minor, and Warning that are not in Maintenance mode

questions.question: Which are recommended best practices for Event Management? (Choose three.)
answers: A. Filter out events on ServiceNow Instance for easier consolidation and aggregation.
B. Promote all events to alerts during initial implementation until you fully understand which should be ignored.
C. Filter out events at source rather than in the ServiceNow instance.
D. Base-line “normal-state” events to filter out background noise.
E. Ignore all non-critical events during initial implementation to streamline processing; add alerts over time as time and resources allow.

comments.content:
The recommended best practices for Event Management are:

C. Filter out events at the source rather than in the ServiceNow instance.

Filtering events at the source reduces unnecessary noise and improves efficiency in the processing of events.
D. Base-line "normal-state" events to filter out background noise.

Establishing a baseline for normal events helps filter out background noise, making it easier to identify and prioritize abnormal or critical events.
E. Ignore all non-critical events during the initial implementation to streamline processing; add alerts over time as time and resources allow.

questions.question: For an incoming event with a matching message key, what allows an existing alert to be automatically closed?
answers: A. In the event rule, set the Severity to 0
B. In the alert rule, set the Severity to 0
C. In the alert rule, set the Severity to -1
D. In the event rule, set the Severity to -1

comments.content: A. Setting severity to 0 is equals to Clear event
In short, 0 will clear the alert.

questions.question:
A support agent resolves an incident associated with an alert, but the alert does automatically close even though the evt_mgmt.incident_closes_alert property is set appropriately to close the alert.
What is the most likely cause of this issue?
answers: A. The support agent does not have the evt_mgmt_user role.
B. The support agent only has the evt_mgmt_admin role.
C. The support agent has the evt_mgmt_operator role, but not the evt_mgmt_user role.
D. The support agent has the evt_mgmt_user role, but not the evt_mgmt_operator role.

comments.content:
A
Role required: evt_mgmt_admin, evt_mgmt_operator, or evt_mgmt_user
Role required: evt_mgmt_admin, evt_mgmt_operator, OR evt_mgmt_user
the evt_mgmt_user is enough to close alert through incident

Answer is 'B'. Having only evt_mgmt_admin role causes this problem. Agent should also have either evt_mgmt_user or evt_mgmt_operator role as mentioned in document -  
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/task/t_EMResolveCloseIncidentAlert.html
It's D. You need operator to take actions on alerts.

Question is worded erroneously, should be "A support agent resolves an incident associated with an alert, but the alert does NOT automatically close even though the evt_mgmt.incident_closes_alert property is set appropriately to close the alert."

Based on that question, correct answer is A (only evt_mgmt_user is needed).
Changing to A after reading this: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/task/t_EMResolveCloseIncidentAlert.html
D. The support agent has the evt_mgmt_user role, but not the evt_mgmt_operator role.

C. All CIs stored in the CMDB must have an assigned IP address within your infrastructure.
D. A CI is any component within your infrastructure that needs to be managed in order to deliver Services.

questions.question:
A four node cluster makes up the components (CIs) of a Business Service. The impact influence for the cluster is set to 60%.
How many members of the cluster must be in a Critical state in order for the Business Service to display as Critical in the Impact Tree?

comments.content: Has to be C. each node has 25% influence. so to go over 60%, it has to be 3 which would make it 3*25 = 75 which is more than 60.
you need 3 nodes to exceed the threashold
In 4 Node cluster, 2 only makes 50%, so correct answer should be C which is above 60% (I.e 75%)
It's C - it's a four node which means each has 25% influence. In order to hit 60% you need to have three nodes (75%). Two nodes are only 50%.
Correct answer is C, it has to exceed impact influence, B only equals the impact influence

questions.question: The MID Server requires an outbound connection on which port?
If more than one event rule applies to a particular event or metric, which of the event rules will run based upon the Order of execution number?
answers: A. Only the event rule with the highest Order of execution number will run.
B. Only the event rule with the lowest Order of execution number will run.
C. All event rules will run, from the lowest to the highest Order of execution numbers.
D. All event rules will run, from the highest to the lowest Order of execution numbers.

comments.content: The question itself says 'If more than one event rule applies to a particular event or metric' that means we are considering more than one event rule here and the order of execution is from low to high in that case.
In Utah we need to mark the ""Apply additional matching rules" checkbox to execute additional rules based on order
Since Tokyo release the correct answer is C
It's a crappy question, either B or C "could" be correct...it all depends on how the "Apply additional matching rules" field on those event rules is set.

I know the blueprint answer. but the video (time stamp 59 seconds) in the link below states, "only the event rule with the lowest order will run."
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/concept/create-event-rules.html
C. All event rules will run, from the lowest to the highest Order of execution numbers.

questions.question: What makes all ServiceNow metrics, tasks, services, configuration items, assets, people, locations, and information a single system of record for IT and business processes?
answers: A. ServiceNow is installed within your datacenter providing you complete control
B. All applications are built on the Oracle database standard, providing uniformity across products
C. All applications that are built by ServiceNow utilize the same data model and code base
D. ServiceNow runs on supported Windows servers and is managed through Windows Update
E. A single table houses all data elements within ServiceNow
F. ServiceNow utilizes the AWS MariaDB cloud database structure, providing a single system of record

comments.content: C. ServiceNow is not built on the "Oracle database standard" (It does use CSDM, but that is not owned or made by Oracle)
C. All applications that are built by ServiceNow utilize the same data model and code base
Correct answer "All applications that are built by ServiceNow utilize the same data model and code base" . Oracle is not even used by default by servicenow.

questions.question: When are anomaly alerts generated by Operational Intelligence displayed in alert intelligence?
answers: A. When the statistical model threshold is breached
B. When they are promoted to IT alerts
C. When it is manually promoted in insights explorer
D. When the anomaly score is greater than 100

comments.content:
A. When the statistical model threshold is breached
All other options makes no sense, as you can read in the documentation:
"Data that is outside the control bounds is considered a statistical outlier. These outliers are used to compute an anomaly score, which is a value between 0–10 that indicates the degree to which the metric appears unlikely. When an anomaly score is above a threshold, an anomaly alert is generated. Anomaly alerts are reported separately from regular IT alerts."

A. When the statistical model threshold is breached
All other options makes no sense, as you can read in the documentation:
"Data that is outside the control bounds is considered a statistical outlier. These outliers are used to compute an anomaly score, which is a value between 0–10 that indicates the degree to which the metric appears unlikely. When an anomaly score is above a threshold, an anomaly alert is generated. Anomaly alerts are reported separately from regular IT alerts."

answers: E. Create a service catalog request

questions.question: What ServiceNow feature would you configure to process incoming email to create events?
Within a PowerShell script, which two URI’s could you use to log events directly to the ServiceNow event table? (Choose two.)
If more than one alert management rule applies to a particular alert, which of the rules will run based upon the Order of execution field?
answers: A. Only the alert management rule with the highest Order of execution number will run.
B. Only the alert management rule with the lowest Order of execution number will run.
C. All alert management rules will run, from the lowest to the highest Order of execution numbers.
D. All alert management rules will run, from the highest to the lowest Order of execution numbers.

comments.content:
This questions is outdated, given Alert Management Rule has a field "Multiple alert rules", which define whether to execute other matching Alert Management Rule.
If happen to have this question, well the best is C, as default value of above field during Alert Management Rule creation is set to "Search for additional rules"
C. All alert management rules will run, from the lowest to the highest Order of execution numbers.

questions.question: Alerts are processed using which of the following? (Choose three.)
The individual commands that the Agent Client Collector executes on the host are known as what? (Choose three.)
What is Event Management licensing based on?
answers: A. The number of unique nodes that can send events to the instance
B. The number of connectors and listeners it will collect data from
C. The number of connectors it will collect data from
D. The number of CIs in the CMDB that it will be monitoring

comments.content: Your node count is based on the amount of infrastructure (servers for example) that will be sending events.

Answer is D
The Event Management - Node Count Store job calculates the number of unique nodes that send event information, either directly or through third-parties, to Event Management and are eligible for licensing in the last year. The information from this job is stored in the License Usage [em_unique_nodes] table for visibility by all users. CIs bound to alerts are counted towards licensing; if there are no CIs that are bound to alerts, the event node field is used. Node is a reference to a server, not the instances of the software on it. Your node count is based on the amount of infrastructure (servers for example) that will be sending events.

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/task/license-usage.html
D is wrong. The unique number of nodes counts into the license of event management.

D is wrong. Only the CIs bound to alerts in the last year are calculated for licensing. It does NOT count the # of CIs being monitored in the CMDB. 
"The Event Management - Node Count job calculates the number of unique nodes that send event information, either directly or through third-parties, to Event Management and are eligible for licensing in the last year"
replies: Correct, now in xanadu release it is a new job in an own license application build by ServiceNow

answers: A. The check is tested on an existing agent/host
C. Agents re-run the discovery policy
D. MID server synchronization is initiated

comments.content: You have to republish any policy you change, or it will not change the table on the instance and take effect. Restarting agents will only read the old unmodified table.

questions.question: Within the ServiceNow IT Operations Management solution set, which statement most accurately describes what Event Management is?
answers: A. The process responsible for defining, analyzing, planning, measuring, and improving all aspects of the availability of IT services
B. The process responsible for ensuring the capacity of IT Services and IT infrastructure is able to deliver agreed upon service level targets in a cost-effective manner
C. The process responsible for monitoring all abnormal occurrences throughout the IT infrastructure, allowing for normal operations, and detecting and escalating exception conditions
D. The process responsible for recovery action and planning through machine learning

comments.content: I would choose C as well
C. The process responsible for monitoring all abnormal occurrences throughout the IT infrastructure, allowing for normal operations, and detecting and escalating exception conditions

questions.question: When creating a task from an alert what Event Management Module would be used?
What is the preferred method of parsing in the Transform/Compose step of an event rule?
What are the server requirements to allow Operational Intelligence to successfully collect operational metric data via a push?
answers: A. This requires a minimum of three MID Servers - two for Event Management and one additional MID Server dedicated for use by Operational Intelligence (OI).
B. This requires a MID Web Server in addition to the MID Server.
C. Nothing additional is required; this is handled by the MID Server.
D. This requires a minimum of two MID Servers - one for Event Management and one additional MID Server dedicated for use by Operational Intelligence (OI).

comments.content: B. This requires a MID Web Server in addition to the MID Server.

questions.question: A dynamic grouping of CIs based upon common criteria (filtered CI classes) that can be visualized in operator workspace is called?

comments.content:
You can see service maps like this on the Operator Workspace
dashboard. Later in this tutorial, you will learn about the dashboard and
what an application service looks like when an alert is associated with a
CI.
Types of application services
Event Management classifies application services into the following
types:
Technical services
A technical service is a dynamic grouping of CIs based on some
common criteria. For example, a technical service could be comprised
of all web servers or all Oracle databases for a specific location, like
North America.
Application services
An application service can consist of discovered services, manual
services, or both. A discovered service is an application service
that the Service Mapping application finds (if your organization uses
Service Mapping). A manual service is an application service that your
administrator configures by selecting and adding each CI and specifying
the relationships between CIs.

B is correct.
In the training material:
Technical services are published to service owners and typically underpin one or more business or application services. Dynamic CI Groups are technical services populated with a relationship to a CMDB group. It is a dynamic grouping of CIs based on common criteria like all Oracle databases in North America.
In older releases it was called "Technical service", but nowdays it is called Dynamic CI Group

questions.question: A load balanced web application has a cluster of 5 Apache nodes. When considering impact calculation with application cluster member rule influence set to 45, how many impacted nodes within that cluster would cause the overall application service to have a degradation of service?

comments.content:
D is the correct one
If there is 5 nodes, 100% / 5 = 20%, this is the influence of each node.
When setting the influence to 45, it requires 3 node to exceed 45 (i.e. 20 x 3 = 60) in order to show impact

Considering 5 nodes in cluster each has 20% influence. 100 / 5 = 20.
So to exceed 45, it needs 3 nodes impacted. 20+20+20 = 60 > 45.

questions.question: Which is the best option to reduce latency issues when receiving events?
answers: A. Verify bucket field in em_event table > 0

comments.content: Verify that the Bucket field in the event [em_event] table is set to a value that is greater than zero (0).

Event processing: Best practices
1. For large network environment
- Enable multi-node processing (event_processor_enable_multi_node is Yes)
- Increase the number of scheduled jobs processing events to 4 (event_processor_job_count)

2. Latency issues when receiving events
- Verify that the bucket field in the event (em_event) table is set to a value greater than zero (0)
A. Verify bucket field in em_event table > 0
A. Verify bucket field in em_event table > 0

replies: A under topic "Latency issues for receiving events"

questions.question: The default polling time to collect events from an event source is:
Which two methods can be used to improve the processing of events in large network environments? (Choose two.)
answers: B. Increase the source polling interval
C. Ensure the bucket value in the event table is greater than 0
D. Increase the number of scheduled jobs processing events

comments.content:
Event processing: Best practices
1. For large network environment
- Enable multi-node processing (event_processor_enable_multi_node is Yes)
- Increase the number of scheduled jobs processing events to 4 (event_processor_job_count)

2. Latency issues when receiving events
- Verify that the bucket field in the event (em_event) table is set to a value greater than zero (0)

questions.question: The Event Management operator workspace can display all of the following except?

technical service, and alert group. For services, you can also open a
service map to view relationships between CIs in the service.

questions.question: The additional information field is a JSON string that gives more information about an event. An example of a supported JSON string is:

comments.content:
D is more proper.
Although A, C, D are all valid JSON, but we should always refer to the existing way ServiceNow supported. In the Now Learning it is stated:
- Supported JSON format "{"MEMORY";"70"}"

A, C, and D are all valid JSON (A is also valid because integers do not necessarily have to be in quotes).

However, note that at this time, ServiceNow only accepts up to ES5 JSON (not ES6 yet), and while there are still three correct answers, C is the most correct, because most examples on the SN doc sites display concatenated k/v pairs more often than not. Examples here:

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-integrate-applications/page/administer/import-sets/reference/json-data-source-examples.html
C and D are both correct?
replies: i guess the "" makes D even more correct. But integers do not have to be in quotes, i believe.
